result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle S. Bonn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michelle S. Bonn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michelle S. Bonn was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge
** Pay restitution plus surcharges - to be determined.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Review hearing on 11/6/15 @ 9 a.m..  P&P to provide written report by 11/2/15.  Report to also include her compliance with Child Support payments. 60 days work crew ordered - Agent to set up work crew within 10 days.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

timeConds.notes: " DEFENDANT ORDERED TO COMPLETE 60 DAYS OF WORK CREW AS A CONDTION OF PROBATION.."

AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION.  Huber allowed if working.  Agent will have the authority to monitor the deft's work crew assignment.  Agent to notify the court if deft will not be accepted back into the work crew program.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years.  See conditions.  Restitution ordered; to be determined.  If revoked, credit for 1 day.  Deft also ordered to complete 60 days of work crew as a condition of probation - agent to make arrangements w/in 10 days.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.
Sentencing hearing on July 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Due to ongoing jury trial, sentencing for 6/17/15 is adjourned; parties notified via email

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Atty Andrea Rufo appeared for def., who is excused from attending this hearing.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  At the request of Atty Rufo, sentencing is adj. to 6/17/15 at 3:30.  Bond continued.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 6/5/15 @ 10am.  Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $783.00
Plea hearing on April 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Atty Lassiter reports the case is settled.  Due to ongoing trial, plea hrg set for 4/20/15 @ 1pm.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  FPT adj. to 4/1/15 at 11:00, to allow def. time to consider State's plea offer.  JS remains on for 4/27/15 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on March 19, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Defense requests an adjournment; investigation a possible alibi defense.  No objection from the State.  FPT adj to 3/18/15 @ 10:15am, JS 4/27/15 @ 9am.

Defendant, Michelle S. Bonn, appeared with Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 3.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
